values:
thanks to jun, i suddenly remember i have a blog.

it seems quite ironic that my first entry for 2009 should be typed on a PC in MFA's library during lunchtime.
i know i know — what the heck am i doing in the library during lunchtimer right?
its not an interesting reason and im too lazy to explain.

hmm. could this post be a indication how the rest of my life this year would turn out? i sincerely hope not. 

well, its time to go clear my hotmail inbox (it has been accumulating tons of junk mail thanks to my darn internet at home.
while i love living in kallang (the food! the mrt! thank you jln besar town council!), the connectivity here leaves little to be desired.
or maybe its just my brother tinkering with the router again.

ohwell, peace out :)

1. finding out you had a paper cut when you were squeezing a lime over a lunch of hokkien mee 
i grimaced, shook my hand up and down to distract myself from the pain, sucked on it, ...the stinging lasted an agonising 5 minutes. 
any good idea to prevent paper cuts? 
this beats the blood test i took in sec 3 (remember, the one with a 3-inch long needle?) hands down.

2, the aftermath of muaythai class.
my bruise on the foot from 2 weeks back has pretty much subsided, but the pain is still there, and the bruises on the shins are regulars after each class. here's how my foot looked like 2 hours after the session where i injured it:

kindly ignore the unsightly and peeling blue polish on the toenails. 
and anyway, this may sound like im complaining but i actually quite enjoy the jabs, punches, crosses, hooks, kicks,,, 
and water just tastes so sweet after class (brings back old memories of water parade during the npcc days, haha)
anyone wants to sign up so we can share the joy (and slight, but rather satisfactory sense of pain) together?

3. a sore and stiff neck from staring at a laptop all day
yesterday night i discovered that if i tilted my head backwards and slowly rotated in an arch (imagine squeezing your neck against the upper part of your neck), a joyful cacophony of crrrrracking sounds would emerge.
addicted to it, i was doing the head-tilting action every other minute at work, and now i suspect ive sprained some part of my neck because it hurts to look down (i.e chin tucked inwards)
anyone knows a good place for neck massage?

NOTE: 
if you have an answer to any of the above questions, kindly let me know! im seriously in need of answers, or risk subjecting myself to more oww-ful times as
1. im still doing paperwork for my aunt
2. im still taking muaythai
3. im still facing the laptop everyday (and ironically, every night, as i voluntarily surf the net then)

so long, and ms sarajavo, now you cant say my LJ is stagnant :P
cheers and peace out!

Do you hear me
Do you care
Do you hear me
Do you care

My lips are moving and the sound's coming out
The words are audible but I have my doubts
That you realize what has been said
You look at me as if you're in a daze
It's like the feeling at the end of the page
When you realize you don't know what you just read

What are words for
When no one listens anymore
What are words for
When no one listens what are words for
When no one listens there's no use talking at all

I might as well go up and talk to a wall
'Cause all the words are having no effect at all
Its a funny thing am I all alone
Something has to happen to change the direction
What little filters through is giving you the wrong impression 
It's a sorry state, I say to myself

Let me get by over your dead body
Hope to see you soon
Doors three feet wide with no locks open
Walking always backwards in faces of strangers
Time could be my friend
But it's less than nowhere now

Pursue it any further and another thing you'll find
Not only are they deaf and dumb but they
Could be going blind no one notices
I think I'll dye my hair blue
Media overload bombarding you with action
It's getting near impossible to cause distraction
Someone answer me before I pull out the plug

What are words for
When no one listens anymore
What are words for
When no one listens what are words for
When no one listens there's no use talking at all

(Words - Missing Persons)

1. i failed my driving test having incurred 32 points and an immediate failure for doing a right turn instead of a U-turn. icing on the cake? my re-test date is september 11. nuff' sad.
  2. the HTC children ministry Superhero kids camp is officially over. now i can get my sleep back
  3. i finally watched a movie. two, in fact. too bad pirates and spiderman are no longer showing (hula girls, anyone?)
  4. 3 threadless tees arrived, adding the total count in my wardrobe to 8 (thanks to whoever incorporated summer sales as a sales strategy)
  5. my appeal to NUS didnt get through (technically, this shouldnt be on the list since i already knew it before it happened)
  6. due to point 5, my mum now harbours ambitions of me studying in england. nice, but highly unlikely.
  7. i am hindered in my search for a job by my inability to find a decent CV template. help, anyone?
  8. i have decided to join my brother's karate class. now i can truthfully say my social circle includes people aged 5 to 50.

You are beautiful beyond description
Too marvelous for words,
Too wonderful for comprehension,
Like nothing ever seen or heard.
Who can grasp your infinite wisdom?
Who can fathom the depth of your love?

its been over a month since i last posted.
i know some of you guys have been asking abt taiwan (fyi and if for some reason you havent realised, we are safe and sound in singapore)
so much for the morbid thoughts huh.

the long story short, its my graduation day tomorrow.
we will have to wear a robe with hideous frills along the shoulder hem (the many pics im certain to take will do my description justice)
as shared with grace, megan and all the poor souls that happened to be beside me as i indulged in one of my bursts of sentimentality, the past few months of isolation from school has made me miss everyone terribly. 
yet, i await tomorrow with mixed feelings.
it seems too fast, too hazy, and yet i remember all the funny, sad, happy, stressful, angry, tired moments.

despite returning past midnight, contacts blurry and unshowered, this was my attempt to savour the last moments of my life as a ngee ann poly student:



it was dinner at breeks, and then a good deal of cam-whoring, and concluded with just chatting about random stuff.
i will miss these times, truly.

would love to ramble, but i shudder to think i might wake up with humongous eye bags and ruin the big day
hence, just want to say to my dearest fellow mcm graduates: we've survived 2.5 years of SPSS, creative briefs, speech outlines, feature stories, storyboards, yada yada yada!

next stop, corporate world?
i don't know.

yesterday, i dreaded tomorrow. 
when i woke up today, i felt sad, resigned and contented.
as i got started on my way to work, i suddenly found myself witness to a semi-debate in my head.

why does each year pass so fast?
time and tide waits for no man.
why should people, especially women, be so concerned with their age?
it is no more than the sum of our existence on this earth defined by a worldly unit of measurement for time, but as dwellers of the world, society needs this measurement of time to function. 
so what happens after i hit the big two?
im just a step closer to watching those r(a) flicks that a certain ms ong in life! enjoys giving a 5-star rating to, my citizen rights to democracy (i.e. not voting for a certain group of people who adorn themselves in white), and to adulthood.
yippee. 

and with other similar and perhaps conflicting thoughts in my head, i decided to peruse God's word for wisdom
just wanted to share the passage i was reading: 

Psalms 10 (NIV)
Why, O LORD, do you stand far off?
Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?In his arrogance the wicked man hunts down the weak,
who are caught in the schemes he devises. 
He boasts of the cravings of his heart;
he blesses the greedy and reviles the LORD. 
In his pride the wicked does not seek him;
in all his thoughts there is no room for God. 
His ways are always prosperous; 
he is haughty and your laws are far from him;
he sneers at all his enemies. 
He says to himself, "Nothing will shake me;
I'll always be happy and never have trouble." 
His mouth is full of curses and lies and threats;
trouble and evil are under his tongue. 
He lies in wait near the villages;
from ambush he murders the innocent,
watching in secret for his victims. 
He lies in wait like a lion in cover; 
he lies in wait to catch the helpless; 
he catches the helpless and drags them off in his net. 
His victims are crushed, they collapse;
they fall under his strength. 
He says to himself, "God has forgotten; 
he covers his face and never sees." 
Arise, LORD! Lift up your hand, O God.
Do not forget the helpless. 
Why does the wicked man revile God? Why does he say to himself,
"He won't call me to account"? 
But you, O God, do see trouble and grief;
you consider it to take it in hand.
The victim commits himself to you;
you are the helper of the fatherless. 
Break the arm of the wicked and evil man;
call him to account for his wickedness
that would not be found out. 
The LORD is King for ever and ever;
the nations will perish from his land. 
You hear, O LORD, the desire of the afflicted;
you encourage them, and you listen to their cry, 
defending the fatherless and the oppressed, 
in order that man, who is of the earth, may terrify no more.

a little harsh, but in a society where terrorism dominates and money makes the world go round (therefore our government needs deep pockets to function, hah), it was an answer to a question i didnt think of but needed to know.
and hopefully this time next year my birthday will be spent in a less mentally exhausting way.

each player of this game starts off by giving 6 weird things about themselves. people who get tagged need to write in a blog/LJ of their own 6 weird things as well as state the rules clearly. in the end, you need to choose 6 people to be tagged and list their names.

1. always prefer the sidekick or guy who doesnt get the girl in the dramas/movies/whatever
2. would love to be a godmother but not a mum
3. hates window shopping
4. convulses in disgust at the smell/taste of almond and ginko nuts
5. likes to bury self in thick comforter, blast the aircon, and imagine self in cold climate country (favourite option: cottage in swiss alps ala heidi)
6. can fall asleep kneeling, stretched out with chin on keyboard, tummy lying atop computer swivel chair and legs on bed, standing on mrt (until knees buckle, that is...virtually anywhere, any time.

my people to continue the game: the first six to read this (which i foresee could take a long while).

If I was a lynn, a perfect lynn, how would you know it was really me?

Which movie was this quote from?

Get your own quotes:

1. i found out my new nextdoor neighbours are french and their son is really cute if he was 5 years older or so... someone, how do you say 'nice to meet you again?'
  2. my threadless tees arrived! yay yay yay!
  3. i attended my first jap meetup group gathering yesterday, bumped into mr mcturk who was a friend of the organiser, and spent the rest of the night sipping tea.
  4. i finally found out my graduation day is on 14th june. so, farewell nepal mission trip for good. (but thank you God and mr mcturk for the $200. to the latter, im sorry for not talking to you the day before)
  5. i finished norwegian wood. anyone has the mp3, or other haruki murakami books? or maybe its time to start on good omens. (sorry for hogging it so long, yihan!)

1. i passed my jap conversation test on monday
  2. i survived 4 days of babysitting 4 kids
  3. i had my second last lesson of salsa intermediate 1.5 on wednesday and finally went down union square after an absence of 3 weeks
  4. the agency that gabriel, grace and i booked with for our taiwan trip confirmed our hotel and gab/gra collected the air tickets (yay!)
  5. the treasure hunt that brenda and i had planned for NET ministry's good friday programme achieved its unplanned objective of making its participants experience a teeny fragment of how Christ felt going through those six hours at Calvary
  6. i surfed friendster/blogs for the first time in almost 1.5 years for 4 hours non-stop
  7. i had my first EE session with daniel, sharon and brenda
  8. i started on murakami haruhi's norwegian wood (and am abt 80% through. good prose!)
  9. i attended easter service, and am once again reminded of my loving and just God.
  10. my mum's car got stuck in some soggy grassland at the cemetery, i lost a slipper trying to push the car, and a kind man helped us to steer it out after 20 minutes of forwarding and reversing.

events not all exciting, but i love my life. for now.
till next week, world peace!
but when you get yamashita tomohisa (akira-kun! <3 <3 <3) as one of the matches, you just have to post it up:

to cut to the chase, ive taken up my uncle's offer of helping to care for his four kids until he finds a new maid.
the job scope involves 
- playng with them (top ranked in terms of physical and mental demand), 
- helping the eldest with her homework (2nd due to the amount of brain juice it uses up),
- bringing them to and from school, a 10-minute walk away (3rd due to the constant worry that they will suddenly run off and get hit by a car while crossing the road),
- eating with/feeding them (4th),
and many other miscellaneous tasks including helping them to shower, play piano, etc etc.

among all, my ultimate comfort/favourite activity is plopping myself on the sofa and watching barney.
seriously, i can see why the kids are so addicted.
i mean, we all know and love the big purple dinosaur, but after being subjected to the assorted cartoons on disney and playhouse disney, nickelodean (only when the older sisters are watching), and the occasional cartoon network...
barney beats them hands down. 
oh, unless you count hi-5 (i think theyll prolly tie).

so, have no idea why im blogging when i could be savouring the 30minutes of spare time i have till the oldest gets home in many other ways, but perhaps i just needed to tell someone above the age of 9 about my new job.
hopefully my next post wont contain proclamations that ill never have kids ever or similar sentiments.
world peace! (and barney loves you)

season greetings to all! :)
havent had much chances to surf LJ (except the sprees page, haha) as ive been pretty busy doing stuff, namely work, driving, church (both the sunday school children's nativity musical and carolling), etc etc.

in case i dont have the chance to do so when the time comes, may all of you have a blessed christmas this year!

peace to the world, and to sign off, here's one of my favourite songs from our carolling repertoire this year...

we are the reason
As little children
We would dream of Christmas morn
Of all the gifts and toys
We knew we'd find
But we never realized
A baby born one blessed night
Gave us the greatest gift of our lives

We were the reason
That He gave His life
We were the reason
That He suffered and died
To a world that was lost
He gave all He could give
To show us the reason to live

As the years went by
We learned more about gifts
The giving of ourselves
And what that means
On a dark and cloudy day
A man hung crying in the rain
Because of love, because of love

I've finally found the reason for living
It's in giving every part of my heart to Him
In all that I do every word that I say
I'll be giving my all just for Him, for Him

He is my reason to live

Written by David Meece
(c) 1980 Word Music / ASCAP

time check: 12.42pm
date: monday, 23rd of october
location: home

see the last line?
hence the huge smile on my face (okay, maybe you cant see it literally, but im pretty sure youll be able to feel the happy vibes emanating from me if you dropped over for a visit)
this absence from work (i think) is a culmination of the facts 
1. that half of my colleagues are indian
2. we dont have 5.5 working days, so they get half-day off on friday (though majority took full-day leave) and EVERYONE gets a holiday today!
yay yay yay yay yay! -waves pompoms-

okay, so time for updates abt the past week:

on thurs i got assigned to yet another assignment by the boss (to work on phase 2 of one of their ongoing projects), which is quite exciting coz its an international project involving japan, korea, china, indonesia, thailand, philippines and icantrememberthelastcountry.
im supposed to collaborate with another colleague on further research for the project but i finished up my readings a little quickly and she was still involved in another project (the people at AMIC are fantastic at multi-tasking, i tell you)

so anyway.
while waiting for her i decided to start researching on jap pop culture in singapore (for the jap foundation proposal)
by friday she was still not done so i carried on...
basically i think im almost midway through everything and friday was spent essentially doing phone interviews ranging from the founder of comics connection (very funny guy) who doesnt read much comics, to the chinese editor of chuangyi publishing (whom i almost died attempting to have a decent conversation in mandarin with).
this definitely beats transcribing audio tapes hands down, i tell you.

and now, most ironically, i cant wait to return to the office to check my e-mail inbox (yes people, you can now reach me at lynn_ho@amic.org.sg).
nonetheless, my bleach dvds have arrived (and in working order), so i shall adjourn to the living room to enjoy the much-welcomed holiday i have.

happy belated deepavali and an early hari raya puasa!
(its times like this that make you really appreciate our multi-culture heritage. haha)

If a picture paints a thousand words Then why can't I paint you? The words will never show The you I've come to know If a face could launch a thousand ships Then where am I to go? There's no one home but you You're all that's left me too If a man could be two places At one time I'd be with you Tomorrow and today Beside you all the way If the world should start revolving Spinning slowly down to die I'd spend the end with you And when the world was through Then one by one The stars would all go out Then you and I would simply fly away 'if' - Aiza Seguerra

time really flies! haha. wow. new revelation eh. to all fellow MCM-ers on attachment, we have officially completed ONE FIFTH of our IAP/IBP (sorry, diff dates for you OIAP folks)! hohoho. its week 4 and i still feel a little new around my workplace. NTU is at least 5 times bigger than ngee ann, i think (they have their own bus service okayyy) and ive only visited about 4 out of their 16 over eateries within campus. been busy at work (research, transcribe, the norm), but i recently got assigned an exciting new task: writing a proposal for a documentary to be presented to the japan foundation! all i can say is, thank you thank you thank you God! finally something of my interest (production...ok, at least writing something related to it), plus its about my other interest, jap pop culture! whoohoo! id do cartwheels in the office if i could. ohwell. apart from that. managed to meet tricia and pearl for a quick dinner before my driving on tues. guys, we have to meet up next week (with vi too)! 1 hr isnt enough to talk man. driving was quite memorable, i cleared U-turns and had fun watching my instructor's face turning green. i think it got pretty bad, because with abt 30min left into the lesson, he told me to go back to the sch so he could use the toilet. lol. wed was the gala premiere of death note! death note death note death note! haha. the movie stuck quite closely to the overall plot of the manga series, but was limited by the technical aspects in production, e.g. the CGI-ed ryuk (quite lovable after a while though) i thought the actor playing L was a good choice in casting, but apart from that the rest of the cast werent as striking in their performances (maybe coz the script itself wasnt very strong) overall though, a watchable movie id say. enough plot twists to keep a non-manga fan interested. stay tuned for the second movie coming out in dec though! that, im sure, is something to look forward to. on a sidenote, we bumped into kat (in the unlikely chance that she reads this, it was nice meeting you!) okie, before my colleagues catch me LJ-ing, just want to add on that i finally succumbed to temptation and bought bleach on yahoo auctions! episodes 1 to 98 plus the two OVAs! whoo! heh. alright, happy friday the 13th, peace to the world (especially iraq, lebanon and pakistan), and dear ASEAN environment ministers, please save us from inhaling the haze next year in your meeting today! cheers :)

well, week 3 went by pretty fast.
have started of research work in AMIC, namely ICT use in education (asia-pacific countries) which is interesting to glimpse through but tiring to actually read.
still, im not complaining because it is an improvement from transcribing tapes!

had my first night driving lesson on wednesday, which was a shiok experience coz it was my auto transmission lesson (basically to let manual drivers have a go at the auto car)
very smooth, very easy, very toy-car-ish.
but a little dangerous coz you dont have the stress of the clutch and tend to fall asleep at the wheel.
plus the brakes arent as responsive.
looking forward to the next lesson! and i need to start reading for my FTT.

met megs, aggie, gab, grace, liz, michelle and grace for dinner @din tai fung
scrumptious meal of xiaolongbaos (not the 10 for 80cts ones that debbie eats in china though, unfortunately) and other chinese cuisine
made a hole in my wallet but it was good while it lasted. -pats tummy-
had a nice chat at starbucks after that, mainly reminiscing abt sch and rambling abt work
we shld make this a regular thing, guys! 
its what keeps me going at work.

caught the preview of severance with gab on fri.
id say, it caught me by surprise.
this black comedy makes severed knees and decapitated heads look extremely funny.
and by that i mean the throw-back-your-head kind of laugh.
some guy in the audience even continued laughing till the credits were rolling midway.
go catch it when its out, okay?
be forewarned that its quite...visual at times though. 

meanwhile, my popcorn list:
- deathnote, deathnote, deathnote! >.<
- little miss sunshine
- the departed
- scoop

and if i have the time, money (or treat), and if its still showing by then (highly unlikely)
- john tucker must die
- rob-b hood (support asian cinema!)
- singapore dreaming (support local films! haha)

any takers?

we just had a farewell for my cousin peggy who's leaving on monday for abt 4mths to austin, texas.
im intensely jealous and in desperate want for a holiday. 
but since that's not going to happen till 3rd feb '07 passes, hope she meets some cute cowboys!

well, this week was a little less mundane on the work field and a little more happening in lynn's social life

for starters, i had a gruelling session (ha,ha) of tennis with aggie, gabs and yihan on wed night
my racquet was actually decomposing after mths of inactivity. yikes.
but it felt good to work out. 
anyone wants to sign up at amore fitness, jurong point? :P

thurs was meeting up with grace, gail, gabs, and reka at 'turkish delights'@suntec for dinner.
whilst the dessert was quite good, all i can say is...never let gail pick the place for meals. haha!
we need to get some good food. 
after our paychecks arrive yeah? (nudge nudge, nurul and megan)

today, i somehow managed to meet reka for lunch @jurong point. 
subway! its been a while.
to reka, three cheers for making the west a less boring place!

on the corporate side, i upgraded from transcribing audio tapes to categorizing data.
finally something i can involve my brains in!
unfortunately i was due to finish it on friday but completed in by tues, so i kinda got demoted and went back to mindless typing.
ohwell, all part of the experience i guess.

alrights, ive got edujoy tmr and a netexco meeting in the afternoon
plus vocal classes on sunday, and an interim log to complete
while i might not be able to, you guys have a good rest over the weekend, okay?

to gabriel: 6 days to deathnote! >.< >.< >.<

been having quite a fruitful time over here at AMIC (thats Asian Media Information and Research Centre) yesterday the big boss came back and i got assigned something new...pretty exciting coz we're working for an international govt organisation (cant say what it is coz its confidential but work it out yeah?) and yep, looks like itll be something to look forward to in the coming weeks! :) the workplace is pretty nice, colleagues are friendly, funny, and quite like family (pardon the alliteration, i couldnt resist) interns (that's me and this pretty jap student studying in the US and got posted here) have an office to our own, and we both got our own comps, desks and all. very neat! my only gripe is the travelling time, and the distance (the location itself is pretty cool) oh, and if i ever figure out how to work my GPRS whatever thing, ill upload a picture of The 179 Queue. Imagine a typical bus interchange, with the MRT at one end, and whatever else at the other. The 179 Queue stretches from the entrance of the MRT to the other end of the interchange, where the bus berth is located. and every morning, a sea of NTU-ians introduce a claustrophobic air to the place. so each day lynn's skin grows about 0.001mm thicker as she lingers around the mouth of The 179 Queue, appearing innocent but with watchful eyes that anticipate the moment where a bus becomes too full for the first person at the queue to go up, and then attack! that's right, you have to be pretty thick-skinned if you dont want to be relegated to the end of the 1km queue. i think i'm mastering the art, but i need to learn from george, a colleague who shared his secret skill (which i shant reveal for fear of other NTU-ians picking it up) to get a seat on the bus. anyway. ive been helping kalinga (who taught MASINA before brian lee, whoohoo!) to transcribe some interviews he recorded on audio tapes. the dialogue itself is interesting (all the broadcasting bigshots from various Asian countries), but the accents (fiji, sri lankan, australian, cambodian, you name it...) are total killers i, who prided myself on my speed-typing and docpro-honed transcribing skills, am taking an average of a day to complete an interview. but then again, when you consider that i have to replay the tape about 8 or 9 times to figure out if the person is saying commentary, comedy, contrary, and finally realising 'oh, it's community!, i think youll understand why. on the brighter side, lunch with my colleagues are something i really look forward to each day. some of them are really funny (even my boss, unknowingly), and they have this habit of sharing food, which is really cute. i think even majirangers (haha, megan) cant help me now; ive already bought a box of quakers' choc muesli bars, mixed nuts, warheads (to ward off the sleepiness), 3-in-1 milo packets and tea sachets to stock up in my room. plus the fact that everyday one of the colleagues will pop in to offer food (anything from doritos to tau sar pia), or spring a breakfast treat (just had vadai yesterday)... i think i need to stay away from the weighing scale for a while, or sign up at the amore fitness at jurong point. oh, and did i mention a colleague just treated us to a pretty expensive lunch at soup restaurant today? double-boiled soups with ginseng and whathaveyous, tofu, tender ginger chicken, stir-fried olive rice, and sambal kangkong for the veggie-eaters at the table. very very nice of him. and i still laugh everytime i think of his corny jokes. i hope this excitement at going to work stays on for long. 1 day and 19 weeks to go, my fellow mcm comrades! :)

go youtube, search 'magiranger', and catch the entire subbed series
its guaranteed a laugh and you know what? 
laughing can help work your abs!

say hi to a slimmer, leaner stomach after reaching episode 836! -cue gleaming white teeth and wink-

tomorrow will be the start to 5am mornings and 9pm bedtimes.
im excited, nervous, scared, reluctant, and many many other bits of emotions that form this whirlpool inside of me.
am now dwnloading the paperwork (attendance sheet, logsheet, etc etc) for use at work.

ohwell.
im sure that having survived advert, feature writing, tvprod, etc etc we'll be a little more adept at work (thats what im hoping anyway)
so, to all fellow mcm-ers, lets persevere for another semester!

off to bed now, or i cant clock my 8 hours of sleep.
peace to the world! :)

i am very, very blessed this semester.
ohwell. 
3 days to enslavery into the corporate world!

behind the steering wheel again. got to try out SSDC's sole new model that has an awesome clutch (so smooth, even for people with weak left legs like me!) updates from monday: after about 9 hours of sitting in the room spread over 3 days which does not include travelling time (that would add in an additional 6 hours), the BAsh It Out! video was regretfully left unburnt. not to say that i didnt try, HARD, though. id continue ranting, but lets stop here for now. had fun in town with val, mel and jun. i got a top from topshop, a shirt from isetan (1st and new addition to my future work clothes collection), and three manga from kino. returned mike gayle (which i keep thinking of as mike myers for no reason)'s brand new friend and some other book (read: very boring travelogue-ish chicklit) to the new bishan library. which im appalled to report, has no toilet (mel/val checked it out) tuesday: i went back today to confirm (besides returning khaled hosseini's the kite runner and chuck palanuik's lullaby) and yep, its true. their fiction collection is pretty limited to the more popular series(i recall 3 shelves of nora roberts in the adult section as well as countless buffy and angels in the young adult's) managed to get two new books though. yippee. 2nd day of IMF-world bank meeting. anyone's face aching from straining underused facial muscles, yet?

went west coast park with the kids from church and beach road yesterday.
lihui complains about aching arms, which im proud to say that me her senior of 4 years do not have, despite having had to push countless of kids on this thingamajig from one end to another.
i dunno what you call it; that rounded seat hooked on a rope and can swing from one end to another?
enlighten me if you know a better name for it (e.g. the flying fox, or whatever)

i finally watched moon child (the hyde/gackt/wangleehom movie) just a couple of hours ago.
cinematography was kinda artsy but the slow shutter effect kinda killed my eyes after a while.
plot while not entirely predictable was also lacking in originality.
and they need to hire a better hairdresser, man. the greasy locks on gackt's head -- just not cool.
still, the vampire dodge bullets part was quite entertaining -grins-
and am currently replaying all my laruku (honey!loreley!neo universe!) and gackt(vanilla!maria!secret garden!) songs to relive the past where i was going nuts over them for a while. 
gackt remains my favourite pretty boy, for now.

gabriel just bombarded me with many youtube videos on oldies like 'let it be' and 'jealous guy'.
im in a jazz mood though.
lisa ono's coming to singapore -- anyone game? :)

thats what i think, anyway.
hey, i had goosebumps when storm did pink floyd's wish you were here okay?
am consoling myself that she prolly wasnt right for the band (look how marty's doing with the lovehammers)

enough mourning for now, on to lighter stuff.
today i was totally esctatic that i completed BAsh It Out! and finished burning (thank you God!)...
only to realise that i got too enthusiastic making copies of my other projects i burnt an extra copy and didn't have a DVD to burn BAsh It Out!
so i had to go to the co-op twice (i forgot i had to give the BA lecturer in charge a copy) and it took so long rendering and all that uncle johnny had to chase me out (burning ended just in the nick of time!)

when i got home i realised. 
it didn't work.
it didn't work?
work, it didn't! -cue horrified shriek-

so im going back tomorrow. but that's the last day, i promise.

another thing is, to those who have ATM cards, do NOT apply for ibanking.
i repeat, do NOT apply for ibanking. 
it opens up new avenues for spending money, and ultimately results in a significant depletion of your finances.
just look at how many posts on sgspree and sgselltrade exist because their authors are broke or need to pay credit card bills.

thats what im telling myself anyway.
alright then, peace to the world!
